subject: Philosophy
title: Color and Subjectivity
description: A fast breakdown of Color and Subjectivity for builders.

hook.text: Colors don't exist in the physical world. Out there, it's just electromagnetic waves at different lengths.

buildup.text: Your brain converts wavelengths into the experience of color. Red is a creation of your nervous system.

discovery.text: Different animals see different color ranges. Mantis shrimp see sixteen color channels; humans see three.

twist.text: If color is subjective, which version is 'real'? The answer: none of them. Color is always an interpretation.

climax.text: This means the vivid world you see is a private show, built by your biology for your survival.

punchline.text: The sunset isn't colorful. You are.

quiz.question: Why do different animals perceive different colors?
options: Color is created by each animal's nervous system
